etymologies: late 19th century (in superman (sense 2)): from super-‘exceptional’ + man, coined in imitation of German Übermensch (used by Nietzsche)

definitions: a US cartoon, TV, and film character having great strength, the ability to fly, and other extraordinary powers.
shortDefinitions: US cartoon character having great strength

definitions: a man with exceptional physical or mental ability

examples.text: appearing in that number of races would have taxed the strength of a superman

shortDefinitions: man with exceptional physical or mental ability

definitions: the ideal superior man of the future who could rise above conventional Christian morality to create and impose his own values, as described by Friedrich Nietzsche in Thus Spake Zarathustra (1883–5).
